Data: Lee to Charles, 1 wide woosh, that's swung almost off the strip - Charles bends double trying to get the toe of his bat on it in vain
Lee to Charles, no run slightly back of a length and tighter to the stumps, touch of swing and the ball beats Charles' push
Lee to Charles, no run tempting length, swinging away from the right-hander again, this time Charles plays a more authentic leave
Lee to Charles, 1 run straighter, scooting off a leading edge wide of mid-off as the ball moved away from the batsman
Lee to Smith, FOUR runs touch short and on the stumps, Smith clips smoothly off his pads for four to deep backward square
Lee to Smith, no run length outside off, punched to cover
Lee to Smith, 1 run back of a length, on the body and chipped into the leg side
Pattinson to Smith, 1 wide veers down the leg side to begin in the same fashion as Lee
Pattinson to Smith, no run good pace, back of a length outside off and Smith fails to connect with a big heave across the line
Pattinson to Smith, no run pitched up, seaming in, inside-edged on to the batsman's pads
Pattinson to Smith, no run full and straight, Smith clears his feet out of the way and clumps straight to mid-on
Pattinson to Smith, 1 run length ball, pushed into the gap in front of midwicket - they want two but are forced into a rethink
Pattinson to Charles, 2 runs short ball pulled in muscular fashion over midwicket, it doesn't go all the way but they pick up a couple
Pattinson to Charles, FOUR runs room outside off for Charles to swing his arms, the ball pinging away off a thick outside edge to third man
Lee to Smith, FOUR runs back of a length from Lee and that feeds Smith's brutal hook shot, the ball smashed baseball-style over midwicket for one that isn't coming back anytime soon
Lee to Smith, no run pitched up and blocked in front of the stumps

Lee to Smith, OUT slightly short again and this time Smith perishes! Lee slung a fast delivery well outside off, the batsman tried to cut but got just a sliver of bat on it, Matt Wade taking a comfortable catch
Lee to Bonner, no run back of a length, defended
Lee to Bonner, no run more width from Lee, Bonner has a swish, a la Smith, but luckily for him gets nothing on it
Lee to Bonner, no run back of a length outside off, played short on the off side, the batsmen set off for a run but quickly change their mind as cover-point comes haring in
Pattinson to Charles, no run on the legs, clipped smartly behind square - but there's a fielder in place to collect
Pattinson to Charles, 1 run defended in front of the stumps and they steal one
Pattinson to Bonner, no run goes back and defends a slightly shorter ball into the off side
Pattinson to Bonner, 1 run touch short of a length, outside off, guided down to third man
Pattinson to Charles, 1 run short ball, Charles gets under it and loop the ball off the splice but short of mid-on
Pattinson to Bonner, no run length, cut hard but well fielded at point
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs length ball outside off and Charles rocks on his haunches, slapping a cross-batted shot back down the ground for four
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs slower bouncer helped round the corner by the batsman, beating the man inside the circle and scooting to long leg
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs full bunger on leg stump from Lee, bashed meatily through square leg. Charles is running riot
Lee to Charles, 1 run tip and run to point ... direct hit by the fielder, David Warner. They call for a review but Charles was home
Lee to Bonner, no run slightly short and wide, similar to the ball that got Smith, but Bonner again fails to connect

Lee to Bonner, no run tentative play and miss outside off, Bonner playing well away from his body. Doesn't look like he's faced Lee's pace before (imagine being able to say that about a West Indies batsman)
McKay to Charles, 1 run length, outside off, dabbed to third man
McKay to Bonner, 1 run room outside off, slid off the face to the same part of the field
McKay to Charles, 1 run Charles advances, McKay responding by sending down a slower ball that follows the batsman, forcing him to wait on the stroke before cutting gently through point
McKay to Bonner, no run on the stumps, pushed into the off side from back in the crease
McKay to Bonner, no run length, bit of room outside off, cut into the ground
McKay to Bonner, no run slower ball, tossed up, tries to drive down the ground but misses, bottom-edging jjust past the stumps along the ground through to Wade
Watson to Charles, no run length, pushed out to cover

Watson to Charles, OUT pitched up, misses with a swipe across the line ... gone! Watson didn't do anything spectacular with that delivery but it was on target and that's sometimes all you need. Charles goes lbw after a colourful cameo
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs lovely timing, immaculately cover-driving a length ball to the rope
Watson to Bravo, no run not so pretty that stroke, slashing unsuccessully at a ball that was back of a length and well wide of off stump
Watson to Bravo, no run pitched up and swinging away from the left-hander, Bravo fails to connect with a full-blooded cut shot
Watson to Bravo, no run on the stumps, dug out square on the off side
McKay to Bonner, FOUR runs a shot in anger from Bonner! The ball was pitched up, wide of the wicket and clubbed over cover for a one-bounce four
McKay to Bonner, 1 run McKay replies by targeting the stumps and is clipped through midwicket for a single
McKay to Bravo, 1 run back of a length, banged in at the batsman's body, nudged square on the leg side
McKay to Bonner, no run full ball, rolled out the back of the hand to take the pace off, miscued to point
McKay to Bonner, FOUR runs rank delivery from McKay, short and well down the leg side, Bonner just needs a tickle off the bat to get four to fine leg
McKay to Bonner, 1 run length outside off, dabbed deliberately to third man
Watson to Bonner, 1 run slightly full, punched down the ground towards long-on
Watson to Bravo, no run angled across the batsman, played to point, with Warner again trying to throw down the non-striker's end
Watson to Bravo, 1 run leg-stump line, worked to midwicket
Watson to Bonner, no run full-pitched, driven on the bounce to extra-cover
Watson to Bonner, no run down the leg side, the ball comes off a glove and dribbles away, Wade fielding to prevent a run
Watson to Bonner, 1 run full toss, on the stumps, driven languidly down the ground for another single
Doherty to Bonner, 1 run length, outside off, cut away in front of point
Doherty to Bravo, no run on the batsman's leg, jabbed to short square
Doherty to Bravo, no run tossed up outside off and driven hard to the cover fielder
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run flighted again, comes out of the crease to punch a drive to long-off
Doherty to Bonner, 1 run room outside off, squirted to the sweeper in the deep
Doherty to Bravo, FOUR runs full length, not much turn and Bravo smears a cut shot over the head of point. That was really just a thick edge but it had enough on it to beat the chasing fielder
Christian to Bonner, 1 run full ball, on the stumps, Bonner manages to squeeze it out on the leg side. Good start from Christian
Christian to Bravo, 1 run slightly overpitched, Bravo swings his forearms through an off-drive which flies along the ground to the fielder on the rope
Christian to Bonner, 1 run length outside off, punched through cover-point
Christian to Bravo, no run good length, angled across and seaming a little, beats the outside edge

Christian to Bravo, OUT toe ends a pull shot and Bravo is gone! The ball wasn't quite short enough, Bravo got under it and the catch looped fairly gently out towards deep midwicket, where the fielder had to run a long way in to claim it
Christian to Bonner, 1 run dropped into the leg side for a quick single
Doherty to Bonner, no run length, cut straight to the fielder at point
Doherty to Bonner, 2 runs fuller ball, dabbed down to third man for a couple
Doherty to Bonner, 2 runs tossed up on the stumps, straightening, and Bonner top-edges a sweep into the vacant backward square leg area
Doherty to Bonner, no run comes down the wicket, Doherty drags it short and fields off his own bowling
Doherty to Bonner, no run flighted on the stumps, Bonner misses with a slog-sweep ... it thumped the pads but was going down the leg side
Doherty to Bonner, 1 run leg-stump line, Bonner backs away and drills a shot past cover

Christian to Bonner, OUT bowled him, top of middle! Another wicket for Christian and the wheels are falling off for West Indies! Bonner's somewhat ponderous innings ends with a skip down the wicket, missing with his attempted swipe and seeing his bails go pop
Christian to Bravo, 1 run pitched up, driven back past the bowler to long-on
Christian to Pollard, 1 run length, played into the leg side by Pollard, pressing forward
Christian to Bravo, 1 run Bravo is very active in his crease, taking the ball from outside off to hit down the ground to long-on
Christian to Pollard, no run length ball, drawing Pollard forward, fizzing past the outside edge
Christian to Pollard, SIX runs pitched up, in the slot and Pollard nonchalantly smacks a Dorothy straight back down the ground. Such power in those arms ... *sighs*
Pattinson to Bravo, 1 run length, angled in towards the stumps, knocked short on the off side and they scramble one
Pattinson to Pollard, 1 run again targeting the stumps, worked off the pads to short midwicket, more good running garners a single
Pattinson to Bravo, FOUR runs full, room outside off, Bravo steps out and punches over cover, his bat high over his head as the ball skedaddles away for a boundary
Pattinson to Bravo, 1 run full and on the stumps, turned into the leg side
Pattinson to Pollard, 1 run back of a length outside off, played like a tennis shot on the back foot down to third man
Pattinson to Bravo, 2 runs full, driven aerially again, beats the dive of point but is fielded in the deep
Christian to Bravo, 1 run full, worked into the leg side for one
Christian to Pollard, SIX runs pitched up, angled towards leg stump and Pollard deposits another vicious six-hit over the leg side boundary
Christian to Pollard, SIX runs again! full toss, clubbed over deep midwicket, fetch that ... and Pollard is one more boundary from a half-century
Christian to Pollard, no run gets the yorker length right this time, blocked back to the bowler
Christian to Pollard, 1 run up in the blockhole, dug out to deep midwicket
Christian to Bravo, OUT lofted drive and taken at long-off. Bravo doesn't have quite the same muscle as Pollard and he got under a punched shot off a length ball, unable to clear the man in the deep
Watson to Pollard, 1 run length ball, drilled out towards long-off
Watson to Sammy, no run slower ball outside off, Sammy sits in the crease and prods to short extra-cover
Watson to Sammy, 1 run pitched up, on the stumps, frees the arms to drive down the ground
Watson to Pollard, 1 run full, drifting towards leg stump, shovelled into the leg side - that's fifty for Pollard, incredibly his first in T20Is. It's the fastest by a West Indian too
Watson to Sammy, no run wide of the stumps, Sammy had back away and misses with a swing
Watson to Sammy, 1 run almost a full toss, on the stumps, dobbled to cover
McKay to Pollard, 1 run on the stumps, out the back of the hand, flicked through the leg side
McKay to Bravo, 1 run slower ball outside off, worked away behind point
McKay to Pollard, 2 runs pitched up, driven wide of mid-on and they run hard for a couple
McKay to Pollard, 1 run full length again, whipped through midwicket
McKay to Bravo, 1 run more of the same from McKay, Bravo can't get under it and squirts to deep midwicket
McKay to Pollard, 1 run full, dug out down the ground to long-on
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs on leg stump, Pollard plays a delicate fine sweep, like an elephant bending down to pet a mouse
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs that's huge! Tossed up by Doherty and cannoned back down the ground on to the roof of the pavilion
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs tossed up on leg-stump and he goes big again, this time drilling a flat six over deep midwicket!
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run on leg stump again, clipped along the ground this time to deep midwicket
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run flighted, driven down the ground for one
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs on the stumps, turning across Pollard, big top edge as the batsman swings murderously, the ball flying high over cover-point - but there was no man out on that side
Lee to Sammy, no run Sammy steps away again, Lee goes wide on the off side, just inside the popping crease - no stroke from the batsman
Lee to Sammy, FOUR runs pitched up, outside leg and glanced down to the rope, easy as you like
Lee to Sammy, 1 run shuffles across and scoops a full-pitched delivery through midwicket
Lee to Pollard, 1 leg bye superb ball from Lee, yorker-length and hitting Pollard's back leg outside leg stump, the ball rebounding behind point
Lee to Sammy, OUT holes out to long-off! Pitched up by Lee, again well outside off, Sammy wasn nowhere near the pitch and his heave down the ground came off the bottom of the bat
Lee to Pollard, 1 run on the stumps, keeps the damage down as Pollard turns to midwicket
Watson to Pollard, 1 run full, down the leg side, Pollard edges through his legs for a single
Watson to Baugh, 1 run on the legs, nudged deftly to short midwicket and they scamper one
Watson to Pollard, no run pitched up, on the stumps and drifting further down leg, Pollard swings over the top of the ball and it sails through to the keeper
Watson to Pollard, 1 run, OUT digs a shot out towards deep midwicket, they try for two but Pollard slips on the way back down ... Baugh makes sure they cross to sacrifice himself
Watson to Pollard, 1 run kept low, Pollard can't do much with that and Mathurin will face the final delivery
Watson to Mathurin, 1 run full, outside the left-hander's off stump, drilled to extra-cover - that takes West Indies to 150

3.30pm: Kieron Pollard is in outrageous form and he's dragged West Indies up to a respectable total. Though, when you consider how cleanly he struck the ball, you have to think West Indies' total is a little below par ... Australia's chase will begin in around 15 minutes, so don't go away.
Santokie to Warner, no run pitched up on off stump, defended
Santokie to Warner, no run pitched up again and clipped to midwicket - no run
Santokie to Warner, no run slightly shorter, driven to cover
Santokie to Warner, no run full, straight, played back to the bowler
Santokie to Hussey, 1 wide loses his line down the leg side
Santokie to Hussey, no run full in length, on off, clipped to cover
Mathurin to Watson, no run flattish, on the stumps, defended into the leg side
Mathurin to Watson, no run wicket to wicket, Watson goes back and defends
Mathurin to Watson, FOUR runs tossed up wide of off stump, rocks back and slaps forcefully behind point for the first runs off the bat
Mathurin to Watson, no run on the stumps, flighted, driven back to the bowler
Mathurin to Watson, 1 run dragged shorter, pulled through midwicket
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run short of a length again, pulled to deep square leg
Santokie to Hussey, no run back of a length, wide of off, touch of swing away, Hussey misses with a cut stroke
Santokie to Hussey, no run slower, tossed up on the stumps and drifting out slightly, played back down the pitch
Santokie to Hussey, 1 run room outside off, driven to mid-off
Santokie to Watson, 2 runs angled across, fullish, drives and gets an outside edge to third man
Santokie to Watson, no run fuller, drifting across the right-hander, driven to the man at cover

Santokie to Watson, SIX runs pitched up on the legs - cutting his fingers over the ball to take the pace off - but Watson fetches it into the crowd at deep midwicket, a lovely clean hit, whipping his wrists through the ball
Narine to Hussey, no run tossed up, on the stumps, played short on the off side
Narine to Hussey, 3 runs slanted across and Hussey swings his arms through the ball, the cut shot bringing him runs behind point
Narine to Watson, FOUR runs length, outside off, not much spin and Watson flat-bats a sweep in front of the man on the deep midwicket boundary
Narine to Watson, no run flighted, beats the attempted cut shot, Baugh breaks the bails as Watson stumbles back ... but his foot was grounded
Narine to Watson, 1 run on the stumps, clipped short to mid-on and Sammy's throw to the non-striker's end hits Narine on the toe as he takes evasive action
Narine to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off, bottom-edged into the ground by Hussey
Mathurin to Watson, (no ball) dabbed to short third man from outside off - but Mathurin had overstepped
Mathurin to Watson, SIX runs flat arm action, pitched up, just where Watson wants it and he launches a big swipe over deep midwicket. Costly overstep, that
Mathurin to Watson, 1 leg bye on the stumps, goes for a sweep, comes off the thigh pad to short third man
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run pulled through midwicket
Mathurin to Watson, no run on the stumps, leading edge back to the bowler
Mathurin to Watson, 1 run shorter, pulled flat to long-on
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 wide spears it down the leg side
Mathurin to Hussey, no run on the stumps and turns Hussey around, the ball popping off the bat into the off side

Santokie to Watson, SIX runs pitched up outside off, Watson stays in his crease, leans out and spanks the ball back over long-on for six more. Not enough pace to trouble the batsmen and the swing seems to have disappeared for Santokie
Santokie to Watson, no run pitched up, driven and Santokie deflects the ball on to the stumps ... Hussey was back though
Santokie to Watson, SIX runs full, on the leg stump, scooped high over deep midwicket. Watson has taken a liking to Santokie's slightly odd style of delivery ...
Santokie to Watson, 1 run slanted across, steered to third man
Santokie to Hussey, no run touch shorter, outside off, cut to the man at point
Santokie to Hussey, FOUR runs loses his line down leg and the batsman shovels the ball over deep square leg for another boundary - 17 off the over and Santokie's aura has rapidly disappeared
Sammy to Watson, no run length, outside off and skidding through, Watson plays to cover
Sammy to Watson, no run tight line outside off, gets a bit of unexpected bounce and beats Watson's cut, excellently taken by Baugh
Sammy to Watson, 1 run drifts on to the legs and clipped through midwicket
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run angled across on a length, cut for one
Sammy to Watson, FOUR runs touch shorter and Watson seizes on the delivery to cut fiercely behind point for four
Sammy to Watson, no run length, little bit of away movement, Watson goes down on one knee and punches to cover
Narine to Hussey, no run on the stumps, turning across, edged on to the pads
Narine to Hussey, 1 run shorter length, pulled through midwicket
Narine to Watson, no run leg-stump doosra, dabbed into the on side
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up, Watson backs away and hammers the ball back to the bowler
Narine to Watson, no run length, outside off, worked to midwicket
Narine to Watson, 1 run on the stumps, Watson plays back and clips into the on side
Sammy to Watson, 1 run wicket to wicket, turned square on the leg side
Sammy to Hussey, SIX runs slower ball, on off stump and Hussey picks it out of the bowler's hands, booming an aerial drive over long-off
Sammy to Hussey, FOUR runs slanted across the batsman, leans out and glides a shot past short third man to the rope
Sammy to Hussey, no run around the wicket, pitched up and driven to cover
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run length ball outside off, pushed through point
Sammy to Watson, no run touch short, Watson steps out and cuts hard but straight to point, who saves a run
Narine to Hussey, 1 run flighted on the stumps, driven down the ground
Narine to Watson, 1 run tossed up, drifting in, Watson sweeps square
Narine to Hussey, no run Hussey goes back deep in the crease and chops a doosra down the wicket from outside off
Narine to Hussey, 1 run tossed up outside off, guided to short third man
Narine to Watson, no run flatter, spinning in, Watson tries to pull forcefully but only succeeds in thumping the ball into his own thigh
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up on the stumps, hitting the pad as Watson presses forward - Narine appeals but he's a lone voice
Bravo to Hussey, 2 runs full pitched, Hussey leans out and slices a top edge down to third man, who fields on the bounce
Bravo to Hussey, 2 runs back of a length, guided from outside off stump fine down to third man where Sunil Narine makes a diving stop
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run leg-stump line, full length, driven coming forward down to long-on
Bravo to Watson, 1 run length ball, whipped from off stump through square on the leg side
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run back of a length, on the stumps, fiddled to point off the back foot
Bravo to Watson, 1 run pitched up on off stump, clipped through midwicket
Pollard to Watson, 1 run length, on the stumps, flicked off the hips to square leg
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run length ball, angled across and dropped to point, they sneak a single
Pollard to Watson, FOUR runs length outside off, taking the pace off ... but Watson finds the gap between point and short third man to guide the ball to the boundary and go past fifty
Pollard to Watson, FOUR runs drops short and, quick as you like, Watson swivels to pull square on the leg side
Pollard to Watson, no run medium pace, angled in from wide of the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Pollard to Watson, SIX runs speared in on the full and Watson dismissively chips the ball high over deep midwicket for another maximum
Mathurin to Hussey, 2 runs length, on the stumps, Hussey reverses his stance and flips the ball high over the head of short third man for a couple
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run dragged shorted, on the legs, nudged behind square
Mathurin to Watson, SIX runs high arm action, flat delivery, full ... and spanked over deep midwicket, the ball towering over the boundary for six

Mathurin to Watson, OUT shorter this time and Watson gets under it, looping the ball high out to deep midwicket again but this time it's not got the legs and Kieron Pollard pouches. West Indies get the breakthrough they need - but is it too late?
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run flat, on the legs, nudged square
Mathurin to Bailey, 1 run on the stumps, chopped through midwicket for one
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run length, clipped through the leg side
Bravo to Hussey, no run pitched up on the stumps, drilled through midwicket and Mathurin, cat-like, pounces on it to prevent a boundary - they don't even get one. Top stop
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run tip and run short of point, Sammy's pick up isn't clean and Bailey gets home
Bravo to Bailey, no run excellent slower ball, Bailey goes for an agricultural hoick over the leg side and misses completely
Bravo to Bailey, no run length, on the stumps, jabbed to midwicket
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run length delivery outside off, taking the pace off, steered to short third man and they take one
Mathurin to Bailey, 1 run wicket to wicket, flicked square on the leg side
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run flat, on the stumps, Hussey rolls the wrists and pulls to deep square leg
Mathurin to Bailey, 1 run room outside off, dabbed on the back foot through point
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run dragged short, on the pads, nudged through the leg side
Mathurin to Bailey, 1 run angled into the stumps, dropped to short third man
Mathurin to Hussey, 1 run on the legs, punched to the sweeper on the square boundary - that's six of ones and half a dozen of the over
Bravo to Hussey, SIX runs slightly back of a length, Hussey gives himself room and smears a flat six down the ground over long-on. BOOM!
Bravo to Hussey, no run around the wicket, defended on the back foot
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run pitched up on off, crunched in front of midwicket for one
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run slower yorker, dug out wide of mid-on, Bravo goes after it himself and they keep the damage down to a single
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run full and wide, cut hard to the deep square boundary
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run length, outside off, again rolling his fingers over it, steered on the back foot down to third man
Smith to Bailey, 1 run full, hacked to long-on for one
Smith to Hussey, FOUR runs angled across, Hussey opens the face and glides the ball on its way for a boundary that takes him to a typically efficient half-century
Smith to Hussey, no run around the wicket, slower ball, rolls his fingers over it, Hussey drives in the air - and Sammy drops a simple catch at cover!
Smith to Hussey, 1 run length, pushed down the ground
Smith to Bailey, FOUR runs sliding down the leg side and deposited over midwicket, the ball hustling off to the rope unimpeded
Smith to Bailey, 2 runs low full toss on the legs and swept hard, Pollard fielding with his feet - and almost losing his trousers - out on the boundary
Narine to Hussey, 1 run flighted outside off, feathered to third man
Narine to Bailey, no run tossed up on the wicket, blocked back to the bowler
Narine to Bailey, 1 run shorter ball, pulled wide of long-on
Narine to Hussey, 1 run flighted across the left-hander, nurdled behind point
Narine to Bailey, 1 run length, on the legs, Bailey sweeps hard and flat out to deep backward square
Narine to Hussey, FOUR runs length, spinning across Hussey, who expertly steers the ball fine down to the third man boundary - Australia are almost home, despite Narine's tidy figures
Sammy to Bailey, FOUR runs clubbed hard through midwicket for four - and that is that
That, folks, is your lot. Join me for the second and deciding match on Friday. After all, what else will you have on? Cheerio
Australia won by 8 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
